newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya shilling slightly firmer against the dollar.
newsitem.headline: Kenya shilling slightly firmer against the dollar.

text.p: The Kenyan shilling firmed against the dollar on Tuesday in a moderately active market, dealers said.
The Central Bank of Kenya posted a mean shilling rate of 55.78 against the dollar from 55.83 on Friday. On the pound, it was posted at 88.83 from 88.56 on Friday.

"Exporter sales into the market sent the shilling on a rally against the dollar as sentiment continued to help favour it's bullish tone," a dealer said. "Exporters put more pressure on the dollar, resisting intervention attempts by the central bank to prop up the dollar," another dealer said.
A commercial banker said the market remained stable at 55.75/85, unchanged from Friday with further depreciation of the dollar being halted by players covering their short positions.
Over the next week a test of the 55.50 level is expected with players striving to stay short dollar.
The overnight money market was short with many banks on the borrowing side. Rates were quoted at 20-24 percent from 20-23 percent on Friday.
